question.text: In light reaction, the assimilatory powers produced are

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>

solution.text: In light reaction, light energy is trapped by pigments and is converted into chemical energy through photophosphorylation, forming ATP and <math><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> which is used in dark reaction to synthesizes glucose through the Calvin cycle, thus known as assimilatory power.
